title: There be Gold in the Jungle!!!! Newest PBE
body:
I am guessing that backing after 3 camps will be the best thing to do now... else miss out on 30g....

>Hunter's Machete
>Now grant +10 bonus gold per large monster kill.

>Poacher's Knife, Ranger's Trailblazer, Skirmisher's Sabre, Stalker's Blade
>Now grant +20 bonus gold per large monster kill


>Jungle
>[ Looks like various gold values have been tweaked for the SRU jungle mobs ]

>Gromp
>62 from 72

>Krug
>60 from 66

>Mini Krug
>14 from 18

>Murkwolf
>42 from 48

>Mini Wolf
>12 from 14

>Razorbreak
>41 from 42

>Mini Razor Beak
>9 from 12

>Blue
>36 from 42

>Mini blue
>20 from 22

>Red
>36 from 42

>Mini red
>20 from 22

replies.body:
So with a machete and the changes to the camps it evens out to literally no change from live. Then once you upgrade machete you're netting more gold than you would on live. All of this while lowering the value of jungle camps to nonjunglers.

I understand all this correctly?
You do, better than some others in this thread it seems.

Extra gold gen is great, might actually help out the tank junglers who have otherwise slow clears getting the ball rolling.

Unfortunately, I see this helping all the junglers who are already strong more than it's going to help the ones who are struggling to keep up. The sustain based counter junglers are going to have even more reason to rummage around in your jungle now, and get rewarded more heavily for it.

> Extra gold gen is great, might actually help out the tank junglers who have otherwise slow clears getting the ball rolling.
> 
> Unfortunately, I see this helping all the junglers who are already strong more than it's going to help the ones who are struggling to keep up. The sustain based counter junglers are going to have even more reason to rummage around in your jungle now, and get rewarded more heavily for it.

Think maybe the extra gold should only be tied to the Tank Enchant then?

Juggernaut needs something, but not extra gold. Even then, strong enough counter junglers will buy it for some extra tankiness early and get by on their base damages and pretty much just as well against the junglers who are currently weak. Until they roll out a set of nerfs for the junglers who are currently ruling the roost, any changes made to benefit all junglers will benefit them the strongest.

> Juggernaut needs something, but not extra gold. Even then, strong enough counter junglers will buy it for some extra tankiness early and get by on their base damages and pretty much just as well against the junglers who are currently weak. Until they roll out a set of nerfs for the junglers who are currently ruling the roost, any changes made to benefit all junglers will benefit them the strongest.

Some jungle items should have a Ward recipe within. Like Wriggle's used to. Like Stalker's Blade (it would really fit with the name).

I think that since Juggernaut happens to be about defensive stats, maybe they should attach some armor to it (possible lower the health to compensate).  It'd help tanks since they would take less damage overall, and make the sustain from the machete passive more effective.  Speaking of the machete passive they should put a bit more mana regen on that passive, for all those mana heavy junglers out there (Skarner, Hecarim, Amumu, Sejuani, etc).

The main two problems with Juggernaut are cost effectiveness and the stats it's giving compared to the other items.

Magus is giving 80 AP and 10% CDR for less than the cost of a Needlessly Large Rod.

Warrior is giving 10% CDR, 10 armor pen, and 20 AD for 1337 off the Brutalizer, so it only costs 163 gold to get it to 40 AD, gaining 20 AD for half the cost of a 10 AD Long Sword.

Stalker gets more cost efficient the more stacks it gets.

But Juggernaut? You're losing money. It's 850 for the Kindlegem, 400 for a Ruby Crystal, so 1250 for 400 health and 10% CDR. It's costing you 250 for the combine cost to get to the full Juggernaut enchant, which gives you the tenacity and another 100 health. Only problem is, you're paying for 5/8ths of what could be another Ruby Crystal and only getting half of the health you would get otherwise. The tenacity is nice, but it isn't all that needed so early in the game when most champions in the lanes are having some mana issues and can't afford to spam abilities anyways. All in all it's cheaper to just spend 1200 gold and buy three Ruby Crystals to get 600 health. 

The health itself is part of the issue. The other items are giving damage right where people need it, one of them is giving magic damage on hit, which means it's going to hurt more since you don't have any MR yet, and one is giving both AD and armor pen, meaning it's going to do the same. Even if you were to walk out with a Juggernaut at the same time as say, a Vi shows up with a Warrior, you have no hope of defeating the Vi because she's doing so much more damage, and you haven't built up any armor to mitigate any of the damage she's doing to you. You may have more health, but against Warrior or Devourer you're taking more damage than you would if you had any amount of MR or armor, and against bursty caster/assassin type AP junglers, like Elise or Diana for instance, they've got a massive boost to their damage output and can burn through your 500 health. It's just going to take them a few seconds longer.

The item isn't giving you the mix of stats that a tank needs to do well in the early game, and that's the problem. Between how inefficient it is compared to the other three, and that the other three can make it seem like that 500 bonus health is worthless, it's a massive detriment to tank junglers.

Yes.
Tanks need Juggernaut to be buffed big time.  That item is garbage.

> Extra gold gen is great, might actually help out the tank junglers who have otherwise slow clears getting the ball rolling.
> 
> Unfortunately, I see this helping all the junglers who are already strong more than it's going to help the ones who are struggling to keep up. The sustain based counter junglers are going to have even more reason to rummage around in your jungle now, and get rewarded more heavily for it.

This isn't about intra-jungler balance.  It's about jungler vs laner balance.  Junglers were falling too far behind in gold.

You can't address tank versus damage jungler clearing with items.  Going to need systems or champion level changes.
I can see Nunu *snowballing* even harder right now.

Yup, nerfs to Ranger's and Skirmisher's, plus gold on large monster kill.  It's a good time to try and break Nunu by living in the enemy jungle.

Sounds fun!

Woot finally, Junglers have been incredibly gold starved

Edit 
Oh wait, the increased amount of gold is absolutely minimal while also punishing anyone else from taking jg mobs AND punishing you even harder if you get counter jungled, since you NEED the big mobs to make up the gold difference

So basically 2 extra pots (or 1 ward) extra per clear.
(Note that Trailblazer has increased CD on PBE)

Considering that Chickens allow you to destroy wards for free, the jungle remains more expensive than pre-rework.

Mana heavy junglers (like Sejuani) still suffer for from the Trailblazer nerf more than is made up by the bonus gold (they'ld relatively loose to less mana depedanant junglers anyway).
-------------------------

It's an improvement but it doesn't tackle the main issue.
How much has the CD for Trailblazer been increased from?
it's the same as every other smite now, except if you use poacher's on an enemy camp
The change is to encourage people to not take their jungler's camps if anything. All camps now give reduced gold (except if you're a jungler).
